Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the extent to which All Aboard Florida is a "100 percent private venture" by not acknowledging the public funding and potential public funding associated with the project.
Understate: The claim may be understating the involvement of state money in the All Aboard Florida project, as there are reports of public funding and potential public funding.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by not providing a complete and accurate picture of the financial aspects of the project.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to fully back up the assertion that there is no state money involved in All Aboard Florida, as there are reports and allegations of public funding.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that All Aboard Florida is entirely privately funded without acknowledging the potential involvement of state money.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim may have an alternative explanation, as former Gov. Charlie Crist contradicts the assertion by claiming that All Aboard Florida is receiving millions in Florida taxpayer dollars.
